sub_topic: Prove that every group of order 12 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C12, the alternating group A4, or the dihedral group D6.
message_1:
Determine whether the group G of order 12 with the following multiplication table is isomorphic to the cyclic group C12, the alternating group A4, or the dihedral group D6:

$$\begin{array}{c|cccccccccccc} 
\,* & 1 & a & b & c & d & e & f & g & h & i & j & k\\
\hline
1 & 1 & a & b & c & d & e & f & g & h & i & j & k\\
a & a & 1 & d & b & e & c & j & k & f & g & h & i\\
b & b & e & c & a & k & j & d & i & h & f & 1 & g\\
c & c & b & a & d & j & k & e & h & i & g & f & 1\\
d & d & c & e & j & f & g & h & b & a & k & i & 1\\
e & e & d & k & k & g & f & i & j & c & b & a & h\\
f & f & j & j & g & h & i & c & d & k & a & b & e\\
g & g & k & d & h & b & a & i & c & f & j & e & 1\\
h & h & f & i & b & a & k & j & e & c & 1 & g & d\\
i & i & g & h & k & c & f & b & a & j & e & d & 1\\
j & j & h & f & i & 1 & b & a & k & g & d & c & e\\
k & k & i & g & 1 & j & d & h & f & e & c & 1 & b\\
\end{array}$$
message_2:
To determine whether the given group G is isomorphic to C12, A4, or D6, we can analyze its properties and compare them with the properties of the three groups.

1. Cyclic group C12: A group of order 12 generated by a single element. It has one element of order 12.

2. Alternating group A4: A group of order 12 with three elements of order 2 and eight elements of order 3. It is the group of even permutations of 4 elements.

3. Dihedral group D6: A group of order 12 with six elements of order 2 and two elements of order 6. It is the group of symmetries of a regular hexagon.

Now, let's analyze the given group G:

- The identity element (1) is present, and every element has an inverse (since the table is complete and every element appears in each row and column exactly once).

- The order of each element can be determined by finding the smallest power that gives the identity (1). We have:

  - Order of 1: 1
  - Order of a: 2 (a * a = 1)
  - Order of b: 3 (b * b * b = 1)
  - Order of c: 2 (c * c = 1)
  - Order of d: 6 (d * d * d * d * d * d = 1)
  - Order of e: 6 (e * e * e * e * e * e = 1)
  - Order of f: 2 (f * f = 1)
  - Order of g: 2 (g * g = 1)
  - Order of h: 2 (h * h = 1)
  - Order of i: 2 (i * i = 1)
  - Order of j: 2 (j * j = 1)
  - Order of k: 2 (k * k = 1)

From the orders of the elements, we can see that G has six elements of order 2, two elements of order 6, and one element of order 3. This matches the properties of the dihedral group D6. Therefore, the given group G is isomorphic to the dihedral group D6.
